institutions.name: United Nations
institutions.description: Principal international organization for maintaining peace and security, developing friendly relations among nations, and promoting human rights.

institutions.name: UN General Assembly
institutions.function: Main deliberative organ; adopts declarations and resolutions
institutions.hrRole: Adopts human rights instruments, elects HRC members, receives reports

institutions.name: Economic and Social Council
institutions.function: Coordinates economic and social work of UN system
institutions.composition: 54 members elected by GA for 3-year terms
institutions.hrRole: Created Commission on Human Rights (1946), now oversees functional commissions, grants NGO consultative status

institutions.name: Security Council
institutions.function: Primary responsibility for international peace and security
institutions.composition: 15 members (5 permanent with veto: US, UK, France, Russia, China)
institutions.hrRole: Can authorize humanitarian interventions, refers situations to ICC, imposes sanctions for HR violations

institutions.name: Human Rights Council
institutions.function: Main UN intergovernmental body for human rights
institutions.meetings: At least 3 regular sessions per year (minimum 10 weeks total)
institutions.description: Replaced the Commission on Human Rights to address criticism of politicization. Members elected by regional groups.

institutions.name: Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights
institutions.head: High Commissioner for Human Rights
institutions.function: Principal UN official for human rights, leads OHCHR secretariat
institutions.description: Created by Vienna World Conference. Provides secretariat for HRC, treaty bodies, special procedures.

institutions.name: Universal Periodic Review
institutions.function: Peer review of human rights records of all 193 UN member states
institutions.description: Unique mechanism reviewing all states regardless of treaty ratification. Based on UN Charter, UDHR, treaties ratified, and voluntary pledges.

institutions.name: Special Procedures
institutions.function: Independent experts examining specific rights issues or country situations
institutions.description: Can conduct country visits, send communications to states, report to HRC and GA. Thematic examples: torture, freedom of expression, human rights defenders.

institutions.name: Human Rights Committee
institutions.description: Monitors implementation of ICCPR. Often confused with HRC - this is an expert body, not political.

institutions.name: Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights
institutions.description: Created by ECOSOC resolution (not by the Covenant itself). Monitors ICESCR implementation.

institutions.name: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination
institutions.description: First UN treaty body. Monitors ICERD implementation.

institutions.name: Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women
institutions.description: Monitors CEDAW implementation. Can conduct inquiries under Optional Protocol.

institutions.name: Committee against Torture
institutions.description: Monitors CAT implementation. Subcommittee on Prevention visits places of detention (OPCAT).

institutions.name: Committee on the Rights of the Child
institutions.description: Monitors CRC and its Optional Protocols. Highest workload due to near-universal ratification.

institutions.name: Council of Europe
institutions.description: Oldest European political organization. Created to promote democracy, human rights, and rule of law. Distinct from EU.

institutions.name: European Court of Human Rights
institutions.composition: 46 judges (one per member state, 9-year non-renewable terms)
institutions.jurisdiction: Individual applications (Art. 34), Inter-state cases (Art. 33), Advisory opinions
institutions.description: Most successful international human rights court. Direct individual access. Judgments supervised by Committee of Ministers.

institutions.name: Committee of Ministers
institutions.function: Decision-making body of CoE; supervises execution of ECtHR judgments
institutions.description: Monitors whether states comply with ECtHR judgments. Can impose political pressure for non-compliance.

institutions.name: Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe
institutions.function: Deliberative body; elects judges to ECtHR, Secretary General, Commissioner
institutions.description: First European parliamentary assembly. Adopts resolutions and recommendations.

institutions.name: Commissioner for Human Rights
institutions.function: Independent institution promoting HR awareness and respect
institutions.description: Non-judicial institution. Different from High Commissioner (UN). Elected by PACE.

institutions.name: European Union
institutions.description: Supranational political and economic union. Charter of Fundamental Rights became binding with Lisbon Treaty (2009).

institutions.name: Court of Justice of the European Union
institutions.function: Interprets EU law including Charter of Fundamental Rights
institutions.description: Ensures uniform interpretation of EU law. Charter applies when states implement EU law.

institutions.name: European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights
institutions.function: Provides evidence-based advice on fundamental rights
institutions.description: Successor to European Monitoring Centre on Racism and Xenophobia.

institutions.name: Organization of American States
institutions.description: Regional organization of the Americas. Human rights system based on American Declaration (1948) and American Convention (1969).

institutions.name: Inter-American Court of Human Rights
institutions.jurisdiction: Contentious cases (only states and Commission can file), Advisory opinions
institutions.description: Binding judgments including reparations. Only 20 states accept contentious jurisdiction.

institutions.name: Inter-American Commission on Human Rights
institutions.function: Receives individual petitions, conducts country visits, thematic reports
institutions.description: Gatekeeper to Court - screens cases and can refer to IACtHR. Also applies American Declaration to non-Convention states.

institutions.name: African Union
institutions.description: Succeeded Organization of African Unity. Human rights based on African Charter (Banjul Charter, 1981).

institutions.name: African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights
institutions.function: Interprets African Charter and other HR instruments
institutions.description: Direct individual access requires special declaration by state (only ~10 have made it). To merge with African Court of Justice.

institutions.name: African Commission on Human and Peoples' Rights
institutions.function: Promotional and protective mandate under African Charter
institutions.description: Can refer cases to Court. Also develops soft law through resolutions and general comments.

institutions.name: International Criminal Court
institutions.function: Prosecutes individuals for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes, aggression
institutions.description: First permanent international criminal court. Complementary to national courts. Based on Rome Statute (1998).
